name: mmgenome
tagline: Tools for extracting individual genomes from metagneomes
body:
### What is mmgenome?
The mmgenome toolbox enables reproducible extraction of individual genomes from metagenomes. It builds on the [multi-metagenome](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/multi-metagenome/) concept, but wraps most of the process of extracting genomes in simple R functions. Thereby making the whole process of binning easy and at the same time reproducible through the Rmarkdown format. 

The mmgenome R package also facilitates effortless integration with additional data sources and hence should not be seen as "yet another binning method", but rather a package to integrate different binning strategies. 

The package is currently in beta stage and we'll be updating the documentation here shortly. All functions in the mmgenome R package has associated documentation, check it out in R by e.g. `?mmplot`.

### How does it work?
Check out our examples of [loading data](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Load_data.html) and [extracting genomes](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Genome_extraction.html) in the mmgenome R package. The associated Rmarkdown files can be found in the folder mmgenome/workflows.

### Getting started
Install the latest version of [R (>3.1)](http://www.r-project.org/), [Rtools](http://www.r-project.org/) and [RStudio](http://www.rstudio.com/). Then go ahead and install the mmgenome R package directly from github using the devtools package.

```
install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("MadsAlbertsen/mmgenome/mmgenome")
```

You might need to install `Biostrings` through `bioconductor` depending on your version of R. However, it's quite easily done.
```
source("http://bioconductor.org/biocLite.R")
biocLite("Biostrings")
```

To generate your own data simply clone repository and setup the shell script mmgenome/workflows/data.generation.2.1.0.sh.
```
git clone https://github.com/MadsAlbertsen/mmgenome.git
```

## Papers using mmgenome
### Daims et al. Nature 2015
**Complete nitrification by Nitrospira bacteria** (2015). Daims H, Lebedeva EV, Pjevac P, Han P, Herbold C, Albertsen M, Jehmlich N, Palatinszky M, Vierheilig J, Bulaev A, Kirkegaard RH, von Bergen M, Rattei T, Bendinger B, Nielsen PH and Wagner M. **Nature**. [doi:10.1038/nature16461](http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/nature16461)

The `mmgenome` package was used to extract genome bins from a number of metagenomes. All raw data can be downloaded from figshare. Each metagenome bin can be recreated using the [Rmarkdown files here]() and the results for each bin can be seen below:

[ENR4](http://dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.1613277) The comammox enrichment reactor with 3 other species: [Comammox](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_ENR4_Nitrospira.html), [Actinobacteria](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_ENR4_Actinobacteria.html), [Betaproteobacteria](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_ENR4_Betaproteobacteria.html) and [Alphaproteobacteria](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_ENR4_Alphaproteobacteria.html).

[ENR6](http://dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.1613282) The comammox enrichment reactor with a single contaminant: [Commamox](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_ENR6_Nitrospira.html).

[MBR](http://dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.1613285) Activated sludge from a pilot scale membrane bio reactor treating municipal wastewater (Aalborg West, Denmark) that had both "normal" and comammox Nitrospira: [Overview](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_MBR_Overview.html), [Nitrospira 1](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_MBR_Nitrospira1.html) and [Nitrospira 2](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_MBR_Nitrospira2.html).

[VetMed](http://dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.1613287) Activated sludge from a full-scale wastewater treatment plant at the University of Veterinary Medicine (Vienna, Austria) that contained comammox Nitrospira. In this dataset we also integrated binning using ESOM maps: [Overview](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_VetMed_Overview.html) and [Nitrospira](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_VetMed_Nitrospira.html).

[GWW](http://dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.1613284) Metagenomes from pasty and suspended iron sludge from a groundwater well (GWW) of a waterworks (Wolfenbüttel, Germany). These samples contained an extreme diversity of Nitrospira species: [Overview](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Overview.html), 
[Nitrospira 1](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira1.html), [Nitrospira 2](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira2.html), [Nitrospira 3](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira3.html), [Nitrospira 4](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira4.html), [Nitrospira 5](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira5.html), [Nitrospira 6](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira6.html), [Nitrospira 7](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira7.html), [Nitrospira 8](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira8.html), [Nitrospira 9](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira9.html) and [Nitrospira 10](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/Daims_GWW_Nitrospira10.html).
 
### van Kessel et al. Nature 2015

**Complete nitrification by a single microorganism** (2015). van Kessel MAHJ, Speth DR, Albertsen M, Nielsen PH, Op den Camp HJM, Kartal B, Jetten MSM and Lücker S. **Nature**. [doi:10.1038/nature16459](http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/nature16459)

The `mmgenome` package was used to extract genome bins from an enrichment anammox reactor that also contained 2 Nitrospira comammox genomes: [Nitrospira 1](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/vanKessel_Nitrospira1.html) and [Nitrospira 2](http://madsalbertsen.github.io/mmgenome/vanKessel_Nitrospira2.html).
